abstract: The Securities and Exchange Commission is considering whether to adopt rules that would require public companies to disclose information about their political spending.
snippet: The Securities and Exchange Commission is considering whether to adopt rules that would require public companies to disclose information about their political spending.
lead_paragraph: The most expensive presidential election in history may be over, and shareholders of public companies are still in the dark about whether and how their money was spent on politics. But the Securities and Exchange Commission is beginning a process that may bring this lack of transparency to an end.

headline.main: Letting Shareholders Know How Their Money Is Spent

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Citizens United v Federal Election Commission (Supreme Court Decision)
